alert.note: Alert for Lower Yukon and Innoko Valleys; Middle Yukon Valley; Upper Kuskokwim Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 21 at 2:29AM AKST until January 22 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. * WHERE...Middle Yukon Valley, Lower Yukon and Innoko Valleys and Upper Kuskokwim Valley. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 6 AM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and sustained wind speeds of 15 mph or more will create low wind chills. Frost bite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken.

area.areaDesc: Lower Yukon and Innoko Valleys; Middle Yukon Valley; Upper Kuskokwim Valley
